tests.title: Custom Write-In
segments: There were very
people at the party when we arrived but half an hour later, it was crowded.
How was I to know that she would have an allergic reaction
the nuts in the cake? She should have said something!
Arthritis is a very painful condition that affects not only
old but also many younger people making many everyday activities difficult.
He said he couldn't come to the meeting because of a previous engagement but I think he is just
excuses.
You were driving at over fifty miles
hour and the limit here is only forty.
I
to go to school now, otherwise I will be late.
I can eat almost
type of fish or seafood except for octopus which I can't stand.
The city is pretty safe although you may have some problems if you go into certain neighbourhoods
night.

explanations.0: few. Indicates a small number contrasted with 'crowded'.
explanations.1: to. 'Reaction to something' is the correct collocation.
explanations.2: the. 'Not only the old but also...' is standard English structure.
explanations.3: making. 'Making excuses' is the common idiom.
explanations.4: per. 'Miles per hour' is the correct unit expression.
explanations.6: any. 'Almost any type' means nearly all types.
explanations.7: at. 'At night' is the correct time phrase.

me a favour and pass me the cell phone that's on the newspaper, please.

you can buy all the stamps and envelopes you need.

go as soon as possible.

tests.title: Custom Write-In 2
segments:
Excuse me. Could you not stand in 
 of me like that? I can't see anything!

If you want to become a doctor, you will need to do well in biology but in the other sciences 
.

the cold outside, she insisted on only wearing a light t-shirt.

Don't 
 fun of Mr. Peterson because of his crutches. He had a very nasty accident.

We don't have to play musical chairs at the party. There are 
 kinds of other games the children can play.

I didn't go to the dentist's because I wanted to. I went because I 
 to!

Go down this street for about three blocks, then turn right when you 
 the crossroads.

That new car of yours isn't at all similar 
 the one you had last year. Why did you buy such a different one?

explanations.0: front. 'Stand in front of someone' blocks their view.
explanations.1: too. 'â€¦but in the other sciences too' adds the same requirement.
explanations.3: make. 'Make fun of' is the correct idiom for ridicule.
explanations.4: plenty. 'Plenty of kinds' means many types.
explanations.6: reach. 'When you reach the crossroads' indicates arrival at that point.
explanations.7: to. 'Similar to' is the correct prepositional phrase.
